[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Memory allocation] Does iterating through large change sets allocate excessive memory before limit checks complete, enabling memory exhaustion DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Iterator memory] Can malicious iterators returned by write_set_size_iter() or events_iter() allocate unbounded memory during iteration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Stack overflow] Can deeply nested or recursive change set structures cause stack overflow during validation traversal? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Panic safety] If change_set.num_write_ops(), write_set_size_iter(), or events_iter() panics, can this leave validators in inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Partial validation] If check_change_set() returns error partway through validation, are there side effects that could be exploited in retry scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Error return consistency] Do all error paths return consistent VMStatus types, or can error handling differences cause validators to interpret failures differently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: storage_write_limit_reached] [Error construction cost] Can constructing error messages with .with_message() consume significant resources, enabling DoS through repeated invalid transactions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: storage_write_limit_reached] [Location undefined] Does using Location::Undefined in errors hide important debugging information that could identify attack patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Interface trust] Does check_change_set() validate that ChangeSetInterface implementations return consistent data, or is it vulnerable to malicious implementations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [num_write_ops consistency] Can num_write_ops() return a different count than the actual number of items in write_set_size_iter(), bypassing validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Iterator mutation] Can the change_set be mutated during iteration over write_set_size_iter() or events_iter(), causing inconsistent validation results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Multiple iteration] Does check_change_set() assume iterators can be consumed only once, or can calling multiple times on same change_set produce different results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Hash collision] Can attackers create write operations with different keys that have the same key.size(), bypassing size limits through collision? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Size spoofing] Can serialized key sizes be manipulated to report smaller sizes than actual storage consumption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Order dependency] If transaction validity depends on change set validation order, can parallel execution cause non-deterministic acceptance/rejection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Batch validation] When validating multiple transactions in a block, can cumulative effects across transactions bypass per-transaction limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Gas-limit mismatch] Can transactions that pass check_change_set() still exceed gas limits during execution, causing inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Gas bypass] Can attackers craft transactions that pass size limits but consume excessive gas during state commitment, DoSing validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: legacy_resource_creation_as_modification()] [Gas underpayment] In legacy mode, can the resource creation bug be exploited to execute transactions that pay less gas than their actual cost? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: new()] [Hard fork risk] If feature_version thresholds change in future upgrades, can this cause validators on different versions to permanently fork? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: for_feature_version_3()] [Deprecated logic] Can keeping deprecated hardcoded limits for version 3 create security vulnerabilities when old transactions are replayed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: from_gas_params()] [Backward compatibility] If new fields are added to gas_params, does from_gas_params() handle missing fields safely without panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [MB constant] The constant MB = 1 << 20 in for_feature_version_3() - can bit shift operations behave unexpectedly on non-standard platforms? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Addition ordering] Does the order of operations in write_op_size = len + (key.size() as u64) prevent overflow detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm-types/src/storage/change_set_configs.rs] [Function: check_change_set()] [Cumulative error] Can repeated additions in write_set_size accumulation compound rounding errors if key.size() involves any conversion? (Low)
